intro: Aquilegia vulgaris var. mollis, commonly known as the soft hellebore, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It is characterized by its delicate, softly hairy leaves and clusters of spurred flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, moist soil in partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety mollis is distinguished by its softer foliage compared to other varieties of Aquilegia vulgaris.
